intro: Pteroneurum creticum, commonly known as the Cretan pteroneurum, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes plants like carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, often used in traditional herbal remedies. Pteroneurum creticum thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or coastal habitats.
